res_credits_help: View the credits for RESTORATION MOD.
Warning_overhaul_title: WARNING: Game closing to prevent save corruption.
dialog_show_overhaul_dialog:
You are DISABLING the Complete Overhaul. It is typically NOT RECOMMENDED to do this, and you should instead REMOVE the mod from your mods folder if you intend not to use the Overhaul actively.

Your game will close automatically in $TIME seconds, or when you press OK.
dialog_enable_overhaul_dialog:
You are ENABLING the Complete Overhaul. The Overhaul should typically remain ON at all times, and only be disabled by removing the mod from your mods folder.

Your game will close automatically in $TIME seconds, or when you press OK.

RestorationModAltLastDownColorDescID: Switches the last down color grading to color_sin_classic.
RestorationModNoBleedoutTiltDescID: Disables the camera tilt that happens while in bleedout
RestorationModPaintingsDescID: Enable or disable the ability for unused paintings to spawn on Art Gallery. As host only.
RestorationModMainHUDDescID: Enable or disable the alpha HUD entirely.
RestorationModAssaultPanelDescID: Enable or disable the Alpha Assault Tape.
RestorationModAltAssaultDescID: Enable or disable the Early Alpha Assault Indicator. Replaces tape.
RestorationModObjectivesPanelDescID: Enable or disable the Alpha Objectives Panel.
RestorationModPresenterDescID: Enable or disable the Alpha Presenter, which is used for loot secure and objective reminder dialogue.
RestorationModInteractionDescID: Enable or disable the Alpha Interaction meter.
RestorationModStealthDescID: Enable or disable the Alpha Stealth meter.
RestorationModDownDescID: Enable or disable the Alpha Downed timer.
RestorationModBagDescID: Enable or disable the Alpha Bag panel.
RestorationModHostageDescID: If enabled, hides the hostage panel when an assault begins, if assault tape or early alpha indicator are on.
RestorationModDifficultyMarkersDescID: Enable or disable the Pre-Release Difficulty Markers.
RestorationModStaminaIndicatorDescID: Enable or disable the Debug Stamina Indicator.
RestorationModBlackScreenDescID: Enable or disable the Restoration Blackscreen.
RestorationModLoadoutsDescID: Enable or disable the Alpha Loadouts screen.
RestorationModDistrictDescID: Enable or disable district descriptions in CRIME.NET.  Not gameplay accurate.
RestorationModSCDescID: Enable or disable Restoration's complete game overhaul. Toggling this option will automatically exit your game to prevent save corruption.
RestorationModHolidayDescID: Enable or disable Holiday effects for the overhaul.
RestorationModNotifyDescID: Enable or disable the notification for this feature.
RestorationModPauseDescID: Enable or disable the Alpha Pause Menu.
menu_support_help: View the guide for Restoration Mod's Overhaul, get support, find crew mates.
hud_instruct_mask_on_alpha: Hold $BTN_USE_ITEM to put on your mask

heist_contact_shatter_description: Jackal & Raze. CrimeNet's asset and fighting force handlers. They have a healthy hatred for OMNIA Technologies and GENSEC.
heist_contact_jackal_description:
Jackal started out working for GENSEC, but quit after an incident with human trafficking, tied to GENSEC and OMNIA.

Now, he works for CrimeNet, bringing the fight to their front door.
heist_contact_raze_description:
Raze. Jackal's partner in crime, and a skilled fighter.

Born in 1995, she escaped her family at the age of 15, and ran to the life of crime, never looking back.
heist_contact_sin_description:
An ex-Sinaloan Cartel member. He was next in line for leadership after Hector's betrayal, but the cartel had no intention of repairing their relationship with CRIMENET.

Thus, he's aligned himself with the Cobra's gang, and intends to use their manpower and expertise to ally with CRIMENET.
bm_msk_shatter_true_desc: The mask of Raze, Jackal's partner in crime. The Phoenix represents rebirth. Each death bringing about new life. Raze believes that the mask is her 'lucky charm', and often doesn't work without it.
menu_l_global_value_veritas_desc: This is a Restoration Mod item!
menu_asset_wet_boat_desc: Buy an additional boat drop-off and escape
bm_msk_canada_desc: Leave nothing behind -- even when the heat arrives, you fight for what you want, when you want it. (even if it's a thermobaric explosive.)
bm_msk_jsr_desc:
Made by a true artist. Cleaning up graffiti is like burning a book, yeah?

Art is art, respect that.
bm_msk_jsrf_desc:
Graffiti tells tales. Being an artist in the cold city can be a painful story.

Graffiti tells these tales like a book. You'd best read them.
bm_msk_courier_stash_desc: In case you wanna grab a few extra hundred dollar bills, and you don't have the room in your pockets, this mask will do the trick.
bm_msk_female_mask_desc:
A standard issue mask, provided by CrimeNet.

Made of a dense material, it's not flimsy, but it's not easy to wear, either.
bm_msk_female_mask_blood_desc:
A standard issue mask, provided by CrimeNet.

Made of a dense material, it's not flimsy, but it's not easy to wear, either.

This was found in the aftermath of a botched robbery on an OMNIA depot, and all the remained were bodies & blood.

The crew's last message before going dark, was ''ERIT PREMIUM SANGUINE SANCTUM''.
bm_msk_female_mask_clown_desc:
A standard issue mask, provided by CrimeNet.

Made of a dense material, it's not flimsy, but it's not easy to wear, either.

This was worn by a heister by the alias of Rosie, though she now wears a new mask these days.

Caught on footage, she was seen taking down a whole squad of SWAT's totally unarmed.
bm_msk_male_mask_desc:
A standard issue mask, provided by CrimeNet.

Made of a dense material, it's not flimsy, but it's not easy to wear, either.
bm_msk_male_mask_blood_desc:
A standard issue mask, provided by CrimeNet.

Made of a dense material, it's not flimsy, but it's not easy to wear, either.

This was found in the aftermath of a botched robbery on an OMNIA depot, and all the remained were bodies & blood.

The crew's last message before going dark, was ''ERIT PREMIUM SANGUINE SANCTUM''.
bm_msk_male_mask_clown_desc:
A standard issue mask, provided by CrimeNet.

Made of a dense material, it's not flimsy, but it's not easy to wear, either.

This was worn by a heister by the alias of Cross, though he now wears a new mask these days.

A talented marksman, he once took out four armored transports in the span of 5 seconds.
bm_msk_twister_mask_desc:
Whomever is behind this mask, is a mystery.

It could be somebody unknown, or somebody you've known all along.
bm_msk_voodoo_mask_desc:
Found in the jungle ruins of a bombing raid, this mask withstood the elements and carnage, and now is known as an omen.

It will most likely find you when you need it most, and imbue the luck to withstand destruction.

One must ask, though -- at what cost?
bm_msk_f1_desc:
When speeding down highways & burning rubber through crowded streets, make sure you wear protection.

\It might protect you from a nasty fall -- but definitely not bullets.
bm_msk_f1_b_desc:
When speeding down highways & burning rubber through crowded streets, make sure you wear protection.

\It might protect you from a nasty fall -- but definitely not bullets.

This is a duplicate of the helmet, without those brand stickers on it, found in a lockup with a bunch of fancy vehicles.

Keep this handy, and you might get the chance to drive one of your own.
bm_msk_sweettooth_desc:
Sweet Tooth, real name Marcus 'Needles' Kane, is a character from the Twisted Metal video game series. Sweet Tooth is best known for being a killer clown that drives a combat ice cream truck.

It's said that he once had escaped from a mental institution. Now he leads a life of crime.
bm_msk_wolf_stone_desc:
Wolf's original mask from when he first tipped over the edge, acting out crimes from his favourite media. The mask was thought lost in a robbery, inspired by the video game 'Hyper Heisting.'

In the wake of the gang's early jobs, the mask resurfaced, and was brought to the safehouse by one of Bain's associates.

The mask's original pattern has partially worn away over time, perhaps mirroring Wolf's own decline in sanity.
bm_msk_dallas_aged_desc:
You & your crew found these masks in the strange Egyptian box at Henry's Rock. The box itself was later intercepted in transit, and the remaining contents delivered to you.

Something about these masks... it's unusual. There's no information on where they possibly came from.

Jackal suggests that it might be a practical joke, or some kind of attempt to freak the crew out.

As far as you can tell, though? These seem very, very old.
bm_msk_chains_aged_desc:
You & your crew found these masks in the strange Egyptian box at Henry's Rock. The box itself was later intercepted in transit, and the remaining contents delivered to you.

Something about these masks... it's unusual. There's no information on where they possibly came from.

Jackal suggests that it might be a practical joke, or some kind of attempt to freak the crew out.

As far as you can tell, though? These seem very, very old.
bm_msk_hoxton_aged_desc:
You & your crew found these masks in the strange Egyptian box at Henry's Rock. The box itself was later intercepted in transit, and the remaining contents delivered to you.

Something about these masks... it's unusual. There's no information on where they possibly came from.

Jackal suggests that it might be a practical joke, or some kind of attempt to freak the crew out.

As far as you can tell, though? These seem very, very old.
bm_msk_wolf_aged_desc:
You & your crew found these masks in the strange Egyptian box at Henry's Rock. The box itself was later intercepted in transit, and the remaining contents delivered to you.

Something about these masks... it's unusual. There's no information on where they possibly came from.

Jackal suggests that it might be a practical joke, or some kind of attempt to freak the crew out.

As far as you can tell, though? These seem very, very old.
bm_msk_beef_dallas_desc:
The Crew used these masks when doing the Slaughterhouse heist.

Dallas chose to keep the design similar to his iconic clown mask.
bm_msk_beef_chains_desc:
The Crew used these masks when doing the Slaughterhouse heist.

Chains, being the enforcer type, wanted an intimidating animal for his design. What's more intimidating than a friggin' dinosaur?
bm_msk_beef_hoxton_desc:
The Crew used these masks when doing the Slaughterhouse heist.

Hoxton had a simple list for his mask:
- Protective!
- Efficient!
- Stylish!

And thus, this mask was born.
bm_msk_beef_wolf_desc:
The Crew used these masks when doing the Slaughterhouse heist.

Wolf's design was inspired by one of his favourite character designs from his game developer days.
bm_msk_vyse_dallas_desc: Vyse stood face to face with the devil of pepper extracts and survived, this mask was made out of the bones of that devil.
bm_msk_vyse_chains_desc:
Although Vyse stole more money and gold than Fort Knox could hold, he had a decency to show some of share some of the contents with sick children.

Bain reportedly visited some of those children, and this mask is their thanks for Vyse.
bm_msk_vyse_hoxton_desc: They say when you mess up, you should face the pain, and try again. Not Vyse, though. Every time he fucked up, he got slapped by the hands of former military, and kept going. Not even Larry, Curley, and Moe could take such a beating.
bm_msk_vyse_wolf_desc: Vyse challenged Bear Grylls to a piss drinking completion... Vyse won, and Mr. Grylls used his survival skills to help make this mask.
bm_msk_secret_old_hoxton_desc: Hoxton left the Old Country to get his Payday in the new. When Bain first told him about the Secret, he fancied the idea of going after ancient items for their potential value, never really caring whether or not the legendary power Bain talked about was real or not.
bm_all_seeing_desc:
A horrifying vision, a nightmarish sight.

The powers that be have seen you, and ensure you are rewarded for your contributions.
bm_msk_classic_helmet_desc:
A gift given by an ex-SWAT enforcer. Before retiring, he found Jackal... and offered only the gear he had access to, to aid in Jackal's efforts.

His curious offer was due to one reason: he saw himself, what OMNIA was doing in secret. But he himself, refused to divulge those secrets, and left soon after, never to be seen again.

Jackal sent these helmets forward. A reward for your contributions.
bm_cube_desc: Push the placeholder, we'll get around to it.
bm_j4_desc:
Jackal's mask. Or at least, a recreation.

The real mask is important to Jackal, and some say the real thing is loaded with sensitive data.

This recreation, however, the system running the display is very rudimentary, and only seeks to replicate the real thing.
RestorationModColorOption: Change the color of this HUD element to your own liking
RestorationModColorsOptionsButtonDescID: Change the color of many HUD objects.
RestorationModStopAllBotsDescID: Stops all bots by holding the stop bot key
RestorationModPONRTrackTitleID: Point Of No Return Pro-Jobs Track
RestorationModPONRTrackDescID: Changes the music track on Pro-Jobs when the point of no return starts
RestorationModMusicShuffleDescID: Changes the music track after assault ends
RestorationModScaleDescID: Changes HUD scaling. May require a restart.
RestorationModSizeOnScreenDescID: Changes the size of the HUD on the screen. May require a restart
RestorationModTeammateDescID: Enable or disable the alpha teammates panel, which displays you & your team's statistics.
RestorationModHeistTimerDescID: Enable or disable the alpha heist timer.
RestorationModMaskOnDescID: Enable or disable the alpha mask on text.
RestorationModNameLabelsDescID: Enable or disable the alpha name labels.
RestorationModHintDescID: Enable or disable the alpha hint panel.
RestorationModStealthOrigPosDescID: Places the detection meter in the same area as Vanilla.
RestorationModLowerBagDescID: Lowers the pop-up that appears when grabbing a bag.
RestorationModAssaultStyleDescID: Allows you to choose the style of assault panel you want to use.
RestorationModCasingTickerDescID: Enable or disable the Alpha Casing Tape (Requires Alpha Tape Style).
RestorationModCustodyDescID: Enable or disable alpha custody panel.
RestorationModProfileDescID: Enable or disable alpha Profile Box.
RestorationModPeerColorsDescID: Enable or disable the alpha peer colors.
heist_junker_brief:
This is a job for Vlad. Apparently, a botched trade deal has left his men & the goods they brought in a bad situation -- Feds are nearly on the case. We have a vehicle ready to get you to the location, and then you can provide backup. We'll secure support chopper, and get you & the essentials out of there.

This should be short, but don't underestimate the police. Bring your fighting gear.
heist_junk_brief:
The construction area is just ahead. Cops haven't arrived yet but they'll be here shortly. Vlad's guys will give you backup but they likely won't last too long.

Reports are that there's a meth lab on site apparently, so feel free to make a little extra money if you can keep Vlad's stuff safe at the same time.
junk_01_desc: Keep the cops away from the loot!  Both the coke and the money need to be defended.
junk_02_desc: Light a fire, it'll alert the pilot of your position.
junk_03_desc: Don't let the cops secure any of Vlad's product! Lose too many bags, and the operation will be a failure!
junk_04_desc: Secure Vlad's cocaine. His own men will make sure the money is secured.
junk_05_desc: Leave as soon as you're satisfied with the take.
heist_int_dock_brief:
This warehouse is owned by Murkywater Logistics.  At least, for the moment. They've been using it as a loot lockup for a while, but recently, they were spotted moving some 'classified' servers. Intel suggests that they're holding some information regarding the alliance between them, and OMNIA.

Loud or silent, the only objective here is to get to those servers, and retrieve the data. Expect resistance no matter the method.
heist_wetwork_brief:
This warehouse is owned by Murkywater Logistics.  At least, for the moment. They've been using it as a loot lockup for a while, but recently, they were spotted moving some 'classified' servers. Intel suggests that they're holding some information regarding the alliance between them, and OMNIA.

Loud or silent, the only objective here is to get to those servers, and retrieve the data. Expect resistance no matter the method.
obj2_findsecuritydoor_desc: Locate the server room. It should be somewhere in the warehouse, likely behind a locked door.
obj3_getsecuritydooropen_desc: Find a way to open the door.
obj4_openseconddoor_desc: Break into the server room. A keycard or drill might help.
obj5_hack_desc: Hack the laptop with Jackal's provided software.
obj6_wait_desc: Hack is finished. Send the data to Jackal.
obj7_escapeorloot_desc: Leave the area as soon as you're satisfied with the take.
heist_int_dock_burn_brief:
No time for detailed plans, they're going to move the additional master servers.
The driver is going to park a truck full of armed clowns in their doorstep.
heist_wetwork_burn_brief:
Alright, we're almost at the site. You've been here before, but we're going in hot this time.
Might be some loot still stashed around, but that's secondary.

Keep an eye out for anything you can use to see whats inside the closed containers. Cameras, objects around the containers, whiteboards and so on.
wwburn_01_desc: Were in the front gate, Murkywater will be all over so get your guns out.
wwburn_02_desc: Locate the three shipping containers that hold master servers.
wwburn_03_desc: Burn the backups of the master servers, they'll be in the same containers.
wwburn_04_desc: Escape, or secure more loot if you feel greedy.
